3121.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3121
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 2
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3121
3121.text:
It was narrated that Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sacrificed two rams on the Day of ‘Eid. When he turned them to face towards the prayer direction he said: ‘Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, as a monotheist, and I am not of the polytheists. Verily, my prayer, my sacrifice, my living, and my dying are for Allah, the Lord of all that exists. He has no partner. And of this I have been commanded, and I am the first of the Muslims. [6:79,162-163] O Allah, from You to You, on behalf of Muhammad and his nation.’”

It was narrated that Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sacrificed two rams on the Day of ‘Eid. When he turned them to face towards the prayer direction he said: ‘Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, as a monotheist, and I am not of the polytheists. Verily, my prayer, my sacrifice, my living, and my dying are for Allah, the Lord of all that exists. He has no partner. And of this I have been commanded, and I am the first of the Muslims. [6:79,162-163] O Allah, from You to You, on behalf of Muhammad and his nation.’”

3122.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3122
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 3
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3122
3122.text:
It was narrated from ‘Aishah and Abu Hurairah that when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wanted to offer a sacrifice, he brought two large, fat, horned, black-and-white, castrated rams. He slaughtered one on behalf of his nation, for whoever testified to Allah with monotheism and that he had conveyed (the Message), and he slaughtered the other on behalf of Muhammad and the family of Muhammad (ﷺ).

It was narrated from ‘Aishah and Abu Hurairah that when the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wanted to offer a sacrifice, he brought two large, fat, horned, black-and-white, castrated rams. He slaughtered one on behalf of his nation, for whoever testified to Allah with monotheism and that he had conveyed (the Message), and he slaughtered the other on behalf of Muhammad and the family of Muhammad (ﷺ).

3123.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3123
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 4
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3123
3123.text:
It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“Whoever can afford it, but does not offer a sacrifice, let him not come near our prayer place.”

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“Whoever can afford it, but does not offer a sacrifice, let him not come near our prayer place.”

3124.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3124
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 5
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3124
3124.text:
It was narrated that Muhammad bin Sirin said:
“I asked Ibn ‘Umar about sacrifices and whether they are obligatory. He said: ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and the Muslims after him offered sacrifices, and this is the Sunnah.’”
Another chain reports exactly the same.

Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3125
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 6
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3125
3125.text:
It was narrated that Mikhnaf bin Sulaim said:
“We were standing with the Prophet (ﷺ) at ‘Arafat and he said: ‘O people, each family, each year, must offer Udhiyah and ‘Atirah.’

It was narrated that Mikhnaf bin Sulaim said:

3126.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3126
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 7
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3126
3126.text:
It was narrated from ’Aishah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“The son of Adam does not do any deed on the Day of Sacrifice that is dearer to Allah than shedding blood. It will come on the Day of Resurrection with its horns and cloven hoofs and hair. Its blood is accepted by Allah before it reaches the ground. So be content when you do it.”

It was narrated from ’Aishah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“The son of Adam does not do any deed on the Day of Sacrifice that is dearer to Allah than shedding blood. It will come on the Day of Resurrection with its horns and cloven hoofs and hair. Its blood is accepted by Allah before it reaches the ground. So be content when you do it.”

3127.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3127
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 8
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3127
3127.text:
It was narrated that Zaid bin Arqam said:
“The Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, what are these sacrifices?’ He said: ‘The Sunnah of your father Ibrahim.’ They said: ‘What is there for us in them, O Messenger of Allah?’ He said: ‘For every hair, one merit.’ They said: ‘What about wool, O Messenger of Allah?’ He said: ‘For every hair of wool, one merit.’”

It was narrated that Zaid bin Arqam said:
“The Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, what are these sacrifices?’ He said: ‘The Sunnah of your father Ibrahim.’ They said: ‘What is there for us in them, O Messenger of Allah?’ He said: ‘For every hair, one merit.’ They said: ‘What about wool, O Messenger of Allah?’ He said: ‘For every hair of wool, one merit.’”

3128.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3128
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 9
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3128
3128.text:
It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sacrificed a horned, defectless ram with a black stomach, black feet and black around its eyes.”

It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sacrificed a horned, defectless ram with a black stomach, black feet and black around its eyes.”

3129.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3129
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 10
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3129
3129.text:
Yunus bin Maisarah bin Halbas said:
“I went out with Abu Sa’eed Az- Zuraqi, the Companion of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), to buy animals or sacrifice.” Yunus said: “Abu Sa’eed pointed to a ram that had some blackness around its ears and jaw, and was neither too big nor too small, and said to me: ‘Buy this one for them, as it seems to resemble the ram of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).’”

Yunus bin Maisarah bin Halbas said:
“I went out with Abu Sa’eed Az- Zuraqi, the Companion of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), to buy animals or sacrifice.” Yunus said: “Abu Sa’eed pointed to a ram that had some blackness around its ears and jaw, and was neither too big nor too small, and said to me: ‘Buy this one for them, as it seems to resemble the ram of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).’”

3130.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3130
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 11
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3130
3130.text:
It was narrated from Abu Umamah Al-Bahili that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“The best of shrouds is a two piece Najrani garment and the best of sacrifices is a horned ram.”

It was narrated from Abu Umamah Al-Bahili that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“The best of shrouds is a two piece Najrani garment and the best of sacrifices is a horned ram.”

3131.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3131
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 12
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3131
3131.text:
it was narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
“We were with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on a journey, and the (day of) Al-Adha came. We (sacrificed) one camel on behalf of ten (people) and one cow on behalf of seven.”

it was narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:

Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3132
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 13
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3132
3132.text:
It was narrated that Jabir said:
“We offered sacrifices at Al- Hudaibiyah with the Prophet (ﷺ), a camel on behalf of seven (people) and a cow on behalf of seven.”

It was narrated that Jabir said:
“We offered sacrifices at Al- Hudaibiyah with the Prophet (ﷺ), a camel on behalf of seven (people) and a cow on behalf of seven.”

3133.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3133
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 14
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3133
3133.text:
It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) slaughtered a cow on behalf of all his wives who had performed ‘Umrah, during the Farewell Pilgrimage.”

It was narrated that Abu Hurairah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) slaughtered a cow on behalf of all his wives who had performed ‘Umrah, during the Farewell Pilgrimage.”

3134.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3134
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 15
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3134
3134.text:
It was narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
“Camels became scarce at the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), so he commanded them to sacrifice cows.”

It was narrated that Ibn ‘Abbas said:
“Camels became scarce at the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), so he commanded them to sacrifice cows.”

3135.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3135
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 16
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3135
3135.text:
It was narrated from ‘Aishah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sacrificed one cow during the Farewell Pilgrimage on behalf of the family of Muhammad (ﷺ).

It was narrated from ‘Aishah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sacrificed one cow during the Farewell Pilgrimage on behalf of the family of Muhammad (ﷺ).

Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3136
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 17
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3136
3136.text:
It was narrated from Ibn ‘Abbas that a man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said:
“I have to offer a sacrifice and I can afford it, but I cannot find (a camel) to buy.” The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to buy seven sheep and slaughter them.

3137.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3137
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 18
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3137
3137.text:
It was narrated that Rafi’ bin Khadij said:
“We were with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) in Dhul-Hulaifah in (the land of) Tihamah. We acquired sheep and camels and the people hastened to put cooking pots on the fires before they had been distributed. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came to us and ordered that they be overturned,* then he made one camel equivalent to ten sheep.”

It was narrated that Rafi’ bin Khadij said:

English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3138
3138.text:
It was narrated from ‘Uqbah bin ‘Amir Al-Juhani that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) gave him some sheep, and he distributed them among his Companions to be sacrificed. There remained an ‘Atud.* He mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and he said:
“You sacrifice it yourself.”

It was narrated from ‘Uqbah bin ‘Amir Al-Juhani that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) gave him some sheep, and he distributed them among his Companions to be sacrificed. There remained an ‘Atud.* He mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and he said:

In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 20
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3139
3139.text:
Umm Bilal bint Hilal narrated from her father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“It is permissible to offer a Jadha’a* among sheep as a sacrifice.”

Umm Bilal bint Hilal narrated from her father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“It is permissible to offer a Jadha’a* among sheep as a sacrifice.”

3140.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3140
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 21
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3140
3140.text:
It was narrated from ‘Asim bin Kulaib that his father said:
“We were with a man from among the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) who was called Mujashi’, from Banu Sulaim, and sheep became scarce. He ordered a caller to call out that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say: ‘A Jadha’a suffices for whatever a two-year-old sheep suffices.’”

It was narrated from ‘Asim bin Kulaib that his father said:
“We were with a man from among the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) who was called Mujashi’, from Banu Sulaim, and sheep became scarce. He ordered a caller to call out that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say: ‘A Jadha’a suffices for whatever a two-year-old sheep suffices.’”

Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3141
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 22
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3141
3141.text:
It was narrated from Jabir that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
‘Do not slaughter anything but a Musinnah,* unless there is none available, in which case you can slaughter a Jadha’a among sheep.”

It was narrated from Jabir that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
‘Do not slaughter anything but a Musinnah,* unless there is none available, in which case you can slaughter a Jadha’a among sheep.”

Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3142
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 23
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3142
3142.text:
It was narrated that ‘Ali said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade sacrificing the Muqabalah, the Mudabarah, the Sharqa’, the Kharqa’ and the Jad’a’.”*

It was narrated that ‘Ali said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade sacrificing the Muqabalah, the Mudabarah, the Sharqa’, the Kharqa’ and the Jad’a’.”*

3143.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3143
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 24
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3143
3143.text:
It was narrated that ‘Ali said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to examine the eyes and ears.”*

It was narrated that ‘Ali said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to examine the eyes and ears.”*

3144.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3144
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 25
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3144
3144.text:
Sulaiman bin ‘Abdur-Rahman said:
“I heard ‘Ubaid bin Fairuz say: ‘I said to Bara’ bin ‘Azib: “Tell us of the sacrificial animals that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) disliked or forbade.” He said: “Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) said like this with his hand. And my hand is shorter than his hand:* ‘There are four that will not be accepted as sacrifices: The one-eyed animal that is obviously blind in one eye; the sick animal that is obviously sick; the lame animal with an obvious limp; and the animal that is so emaciated that it is as if there is no marrow in its bones.’” He said:** “And I dislike that the animal should have some fault in its ears.” He said: “What you dislike, forget about it and do not make it forbidden to anyone.”

Sulaiman bin ‘Abdur-Rahman said:
“I heard ‘Ubaid bin Fairuz say: ‘I said to Bara’ bin ‘Azib: “Tell us of the sacrificial animals that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) disliked or forbade.” He said: “Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) said like this with his hand. And my hand is shorter than his hand:* ‘There are four that will not be accepted as sacrifices: The one-eyed animal that is obviously blind in one eye; the sick animal that is obviously sick; the lame animal with an obvious limp; and the animal that is so emaciated that it is as if there is no marrow in its bones.’” He said:** “And I dislike that the animal should have some fault in its ears.” He said: “What you dislike, forget about it and do not make it forbidden to anyone.”

3145.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3145
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 26
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3145
3145.text:
It was narrated from Qatadah that he said that he heard Juray bin Kulaib narrate that he heard ‘Ali narrate that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade sacrificing animals with broken horns and ears.

It was narrated from Qatadah that he said that he heard Juray bin Kulaib narrate that he heard ‘Ali narrate that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade sacrificing animals with broken horns and ears.

3146.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3146
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 27
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3146
3146.text:
It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
“We bought a ram for sacrifice, then a wolf tore some flesh from its rump and ears. We asked the Prophet (ﷺ) and he told us to offer it as a sacrifice.”

It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
“We bought a ram for sacrifice, then a wolf tore some flesh from its rump and ears. We asked the Prophet (ﷺ) and he told us to offer it as a sacrifice.”

3147.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3147
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 28
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3147
3147.text:
It was narrated that ‘Ata’ bin Yasar said:
“I asked Abu Ayyub Al- Ansari: ‘How were sacrifices offered among you at the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)?’ He said: ‘At the time of the Prophet (ﷺ), a man would sacrifice a sheep on behalf of himself and the members of his household, and they would eat some of it and give some to others. Then people started to compete and it because as you see (nowadays).’”

It was narrated that ‘Ata’ bin Yasar said:
“I asked Abu Ayyub Al- Ansari: ‘How were sacrifices offered among you at the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)?’ He said: ‘At the time of the Prophet (ﷺ), a man would sacrifice a sheep on behalf of himself and the members of his household, and they would eat some of it and give some to others. Then people started to compete and it because as you see (nowadays).’”

3148.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3148
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 29
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3148
3148.text:
It was narrated that Abu Sarihah said:
“My family started to put pressure on me after I came to know the Sunnah. People used to sacrifice one or two sheep, but now our neighbors call us stingy.”

It was narrated that Abu Sarihah said:
“My family started to put pressure on me after I came to know the Sunnah. People used to sacrifice one or two sheep, but now our neighbors call us stingy.”

3149.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3149
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 30
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3149
3149.text:
It was narrated from Umm Salamah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“When the ten days (of Dhul-Hijjah) begin, and one of you wants to offer a sacrifice, let him not remove anything from his hair or skin.”

It was narrated from Umm Salamah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“When the ten days (of Dhul-Hijjah) begin, and one of you wants to offer a sacrifice, let him not remove anything from his hair or skin.”

3150.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3150
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 31
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3150
3150.text:
It was narrated from Umm Salamah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“Whoever among you sees the new crescent of Dhul-Hijjah and wants to offer a sacrifice, let him not take anything from his hair or nails.”

It was narrated from Umm Salamah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“Whoever among you sees the new crescent of Dhul-Hijjah and wants to offer a sacrifice, let him not take anything from his hair or nails.”

3151.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3151
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 32
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3151
3151.text:
It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that a man slaughtered on the Day of Sacrifice, (meaning) before the ‘Eid prayer, and the Prophet (ﷺ) ordered him to do it again.

It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that a man slaughtered on the Day of Sacrifice, (meaning) before the ‘Eid prayer, and the Prophet (ﷺ) ordered him to do it again.

3152.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3152
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 33
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3152
3152.text:
It was narrated from Aswad bin Qais that he heard Jundub Al-Bajali say:
“I was present on Adha day with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and some people slaughtered before the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘Whoever among you has slaughtered before the prayer, let him repeat his sacrifice, and whoever has not, let him offer his sacrifice in the Name of Allah.’”

It was narrated from Aswad bin Qais that he heard Jundub Al-Bajali say:
“I was present on Adha day with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and some people slaughtered before the prayer. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘Whoever among you has slaughtered before the prayer, let him repeat his sacrifice, and whoever has not, let him offer his sacrifice in the Name of Allah.’”

3153.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3153
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 34
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3153
3153.text:
It was narrated from ‘Uwaimir bin Ashqar that he slaughtered before the prayer, and he mentioned that to the Prophet (ﷺ) who said:
“Repeat your sacrifice.”

It was narrated from ‘Uwaimir bin Ashqar that he slaughtered before the prayer, and he mentioned that to the Prophet (ﷺ) who said:
“Repeat your sacrifice.”

3154.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3154
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 35
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3154
3154.text:
It was narrated that Abu Zaid Al-Ansari said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) passed by one of the houses of the Ansar and noticed the smell of a cooking pot. He said: ‘Who is this who has slaughtered?’ A man from among us came out and said: ‘It is me, O Messenger of Allah, I slaughtered before the prayer so that I could feed my family and neighbors.’ He commanded him to repeat it. He said: ‘No, by the One besides Whom there is none worthy of worship, I do not have anything but a one-year-old sheep or a lamb.’ He (ﷺ) said: ‘Sacrifice it, but a one-year-old sheep will not do for anyone after you.’”

It was narrated that Abu Zaid Al-Ansari said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) passed by one of the houses of the Ansar and noticed the smell of a cooking pot. He said: ‘Who is this who has slaughtered?’ A man from among us came out and said: ‘It is me, O Messenger of Allah, I slaughtered before the prayer so that I could feed my family and neighbors.’ He commanded him to repeat it. He said: ‘No, by the One besides Whom there is none worthy of worship, I do not have anything but a one-year-old sheep or a lamb.’ He (ﷺ) said: ‘Sacrifice it, but a one-year-old sheep will not do for anyone after you.’”

3155.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3155
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 36
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3155
3155.text:
It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
“I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) slaughter his sacrifice with his own hand, placing his foot on its side.”

It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
“I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) slaughter his sacrifice with his own hand, placing his foot on its side.”

3156.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3156
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 37
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3156
3156.text:
‘Abdur-Rahman bin Sa’d bin ‘Ammar bin Sa’d, the Mu’adhdhin of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), told us:
“My father told me, from my grandfather, that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) slaughtered his sacrifice at the side of an alley, on the road of Banu Zuraiq, with his own hand, using a blade.”

‘Abdur-Rahman bin Sa’d bin ‘Ammar bin Sa’d, the Mu’adhdhin of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), told us:
“My father told me, from my grandfather, that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) slaughtered his sacrifice at the side of an alley, on the road of Banu Zuraiq, with his own hand, using a blade.”

3157.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3157
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 38
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3157
3157.text:
‘Ali bin Abu Talib narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded him to distribute the entire sacrificial camel – its meat, skin and covers – among the poor.

‘Ali bin Abu Talib narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded him to distribute the entire sacrificial camel – its meat, skin and covers – among the poor.

3158.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3158
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 39
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3158
3158.text:
It was narrated from Jabir bin ‘Abdullah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered that a piece from every camel that had been slaughtered be brought and placed in a pot, then they ate from its meat and drank some of the broth.

It was narrated from Jabir bin ‘Abdullah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered that a piece from every camel that had been slaughtered be brought and placed in a pot, then they ate from its meat and drank some of the broth.

3159.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3159
In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 40
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3159
3159.text:
It was narrated that ‘Aishah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) only forbade storing the meat of the sacrifices because the people were facing hardship. Then later he permitted that.”

It was narrated that ‘Aishah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) only forbade storing the meat of the sacrifices because the people were facing hardship. Then later he permitted that.”

3160.reference:

In-book reference  : Book 26, Hadith 41
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 26, Hadith 3160
3160.text:
It was narrated from Nubaishah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“I used to forbid you to store the meat of the sacrifices for more than three days, but (now) eat some and store some.”

It was narrated from Ibn ‘Umar that the Prophet (ﷺ) used to slaughter at the prayer place (of the ‘Eid congregation).
